name: Engagement Rubric
description: Evaluates rapport building, energy, talk ratios, and overall call engagement

scoring_guide.90-100: Exceptional engagement - strong rapport, high energy, excellent talk ratio, customer highly engaged
scoring_guide.80-89: Strong engagement - good rapport and energy, balanced conversation
scoring_guide.70-79: Adequate engagement - maintains professional interaction, minor imbalances
scoring_guide.60-69: Weak engagement - low energy, poor talk ratio, or limited rapport
scoring_guide.0-59: Poor engagement - disengaged customer, one-sided conversation, or negative dynamic

rapport_building.description: Establishes connection and trust with customer

excellent: Finds common ground or shared interests
Uses customer's name naturally in conversation
Demonstrates genuine curiosity about customer's business
Thanks customer for their time and insights
poor: Immediately dives into pitch without connection
No acknowledgment of customer's time or input

talk_listen_ratio.description: Balance of rep talking vs. customer talking

excellent: Customer speaks in substantial blocks (not just yes/no)
Rep pauses to let customer think and respond
poor: Customer only responds with brief answers
Rep doesn't pause for customer input

excellent: Matches or slightly elevates customer's energy

customer_engagement_signals.description: Customer's level of engagement and participation
positive_signals: Customer references specific use cases or challenges
Customer suggests next steps or brings up timeline
negative_signals: Asks to reschedule or cut call short

strong_opening: Asks if customer has specific goals or questions
strong_closing: Summarizes key points and next steps

monologuing.description: Rep talks for >2 minutes without customer input
monologuing.fix: Ask engagement questions every 60-90 seconds during explanations

interrupting.fix: Pause 2 seconds after customer finishes to ensure they're done

filler_words.fix: Practice pausing instead of filling silence. Brief silence shows confidence.

reading_script.fix: Internalize key points, use notes as prompts not scripts

strong_engagement.quote: That's fascinating - so your data team is spending 40% of their time on Airflow maintenance. Before we dive into how Prefect solves that, I'm curious: what would those engineers work on if they had that time back? What strategic projects are currently on hold?
strong_engagement.analysis: Shows active listening (references '40%'), validates customer input ('fascinating'), asks permission to transition ('before we dive'), and probes for deeper impact with open-ended question. Creates dialogue, not monologue.

weak_engagement.quote: Okay, so let me show you all the features of Prefect. First, we have the dashboard which has these capabilities...
weak_engagement.analysis: No rapport building, immediately launches into feature dump. Customer becomes passive observer. No check for customer interests or priorities.
